prop.name: unitCode
prop.desc: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

prop.name: billingIncrement
prop.desc: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

prop.name: referenceQuantity
prop.desc: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

prop.name: unitText
prop.desc: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

prop.name: priceType
prop.desc: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

PriceSpecification.name: minPrice
PriceSpecification.desc: The lowest price if the price is a range.

PriceSpecification.name: eligibleTransactionVolume
PriceSpecification.desc: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

PriceSpecification.name: maxPrice
PriceSpecification.desc: The highest price if the price is a range.

PriceSpecification.name: priceCurrency
PriceSpecification.desc: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

PriceSpecification.name: eligibleQuantity
PriceSpecification.desc: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

PriceSpecification.name: validFrom
PriceSpecification.desc: The date when the item becomes valid.

PriceSpecification.name: validThrough
PriceSpecification.desc: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

PriceSpecification.name: price
PriceSpecification.desc:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

PriceSpecification.name: valueAddedTaxIncluded
PriceSpecification.desc: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.
